greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors (counted with multiplicity) of the smallest number with exactly n divisors.
comment: This function is not additive; the smallest counterexample is a(40) = 7 != 4 + 4 = a(5) + a(8). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_ Jul 10 2009
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000 (calculated from the b-file at A005179)
mathematica: s = { (* terms in A005179 *) }; f[n_] := Plus @@ Last /@ FactorInteger@n; f /@ s (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 31 2006 *)
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, Aug 30 2006
